title: Knueppel sets rookie 3-pt. record -- in 59 games
content: Kon Knueppel broke Keegan Murray's NBA rookie record for 3-pointers, making his 207th on Thursday night against the Pacers.

title: OSU's Styles wows with 43.5-inch combine vertical
content: Projected top-10 pick Sonny Styles posted the best vertical jump by an off-ball linebacker at the combine since 2003 and also dazzled with a 4.46 time in the 40-yard dash and an 11-foot-2-inch broad jump Thursday.

title: Sources: Trump, college leaders to meet March 6
content: Conference commissioners are expected to join sports celebrities and dignitaries on March 6 in a roundtable discussion with President Donald Trump about the future of college athletics, sources said.

title: Hawks plan Magic City night to honor 'institution'
content: The Hawks are paying tribute to Magic City, Atlanta's famed strip club, with a promotional night planned for March 16.

title: Purdue's Smith joins elite list with 1,000th assist
content: Purdue point guard Braden Smith became the fifth player in Division I history to reach 1,000 assists with his sixth assist against No. 13 Michigan State on Thursday night.

title: Neymar shushes critics after first goals in return
content: Neymar broke his 2026 goal drought in spectacular fashion Thursday, leading Santos to a 2-1 victory over Vasco da Gama in the fourth round of the Brasileirão.

title: NCAA panel proposes targeting ejection changes
content: A Division I football panel is proposing a series of rules changes involving targeting ejections, player dress codes and fair catches, the NCAA announced Thursday.

title: Source: Fins 1st, Steelers worst in NFLPA survey
content: For the third consecutive year, the Dolphins ranked first in the NFL Players Association annual report cards, according to survey results obtained by ESPN. The Steelers finished last.

title: ⌚ Panarin gifts mascot a Rolex for jersey number
content: Panarin wanted to wear the No. 72 upon being traded to Los Angeles. The only problem is the Kings' mascot already wore that number.

title: Best NFL combine workouts, draft risers: The top performances and prospects from Day 1
content: Top prospects such as David Bailey and Ohio State's linebacker duo starred. Here are our experts on the combine's top workouts.

title: What to expect at NFL combine workouts: Kiper, Miller, Reid and Yates answer 11 questions
content: Which NFL draft prospects should have great combine performances? Who could run the fastest 40-yard dashes, and who will climb boards this week?

title: Preview: Who will book their tickets to WrestleMania 42?
content: Out of the WWE loop? Here's everything you need to know ahead of Saturday's Elimination Chamber in Chicago.

title: Men's Power Rankings: Can any team catch Duke?
content: The Blue Devils look like they have the inside track to the top overall seed in the men's NCAA tournament.

title: Latest Bracketology: How two upsets turned the ACC into a nine-bid league
content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

title: Wyshynski's NHL trade tier rankings: Which big names could bring a Stanley Cup?
content: The playoff races have restarted, with many teams seeking to bolster their rosters for a deep run this spring.

title: How a mental health focus aided John Tavares' renaissance
content: Through his foundation, the Maple Leafs center has driven awareness of the mental health conversation.

title: Top center fielders: Where J-Rod, Crow-Armstrong, Buxton rank
content: Our list of the elite at every position continues with a spot ruled by some of baseball's young stars.

title: Let's grade NFL signings and trades: Why the Jets are the clear winner in the Johnson-Sweat deal
content: We're handing out report cards on big offseason moves, starting with the Jermaine Johnson-T'Vondre Sweat trade.

title: Max Scherzer's re-signing with Blue Jays fulfills wish from daughter's letter to the club
content: On Wednesday, a source confirmed to ESPN's Alden Gonzalez that Scherzer and the Blue Jays had reached an agreement to keep the 41-year-old three-time Cy Young winner in Toronto.

title: Mexico violence: What happened, FIFA's response and what it means for the World Cup
content: Amid cartel-related violence in Mexico, soccer leagues suspended games. Will the situation affect the country's status as a host for the World Cup?

title: Inside the secret history of the black mamba
content: In late 2002, Nike began creating a global campaign featuring the black mamba -- and presented it to an NBA superstar. That star was not Kobe Bryant.

title: It's been three years since Premier League issued against Man City. What's going on?
content: The Premier League announced it was charging Man City for breaching the rules in February 2023. City have denied the charges, and the hearings ended in December 2024. What is taking so long?

title: Cleveland Heights to honor Olympic gold medalist Laila Edwards
content: Cleveland Heights plans to honor Edwards, the first Black woman to play for the U.S. women's national team.

title: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao are fighting: Is this 2011?
content: Securing this rematch more than a decade after their first meeting feels like a sequel to a poorly received movie.

title: Women's boxing pound-for-pound rankings: A unanimous choice for No. 1
content: Claressa Shields' continued dominance keeps her firmly atop the list. Here's the latest pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Randle finishes in top 10, Nembhard in top 50
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Julius Randle, LaMelo Ball and more.

title: Stashing these injured players is a winning move
content: Eric Karabell serves up a list of currently injured players to keep on your radar for the last few rounds of your fantasy drafts.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Chelsea, PSG watch Genk trio
content: Scouts from clubs including Chelsea, Manchester City, Man United and Paris Saint-Germain watched three Racing Genk stars play. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Tourists get wifi in Yana, Sahasralinga and other remote areas in Uttara Kannada district of Karnataka
content: GNA in collaboration with BSNL and Acer India, has introduced WiFi connectivity in 10 more remote areas, Sathodi Falls and Magod waterfalls in UK district

title: Over six lakh Maharashtra farmers yet to get 2017 loan waiver scheme benefit: Minister in assembly
content: Under the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Shetkari Sanman Yojana, 44.04 lakh farmers, out of the total 50.60 lakh eligible ones, have so far received benefits of the loan waiver scheme, while the process for the remaining 6.56 lakh farmers is underway

title: Watch: PM Modi in Israel: a missed opportunity on Palestine: The Hindu Editorial
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s 24-hour visit to Jerusalem was a significant bilateral outreach to Israel, but a missed opportunity on Palestine, with complex consequences for India’s ties with West Asia.

title: Watch: Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia cleared of charges in Delhi liquor policy case
content: A Delhi court discharged all 23 accused in the 2021–22 excise policy case, including Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia and K Kavitha, ruling there was “no overarching conspiracy or criminal intent”. The judge said the CBI’s case was based on conjecture.

title: Like many before him, Panneerselvam joins DMK, but here’s why he is different
content: None of those who went back to the DMK or began their new innings in the ruling party were seriously considered for the post of Chief Minister when they were in the AIADMK. But Mr. Panneerselvam was handpicked by Jayalalithaa in 2001 and 2014 to head the government

title: India focused on getting best trade deal with U.S., Indian Trade Minister says
content: “The South Asian ‌nation is ​focused on engaging ⁠to ensure it secures ‌the best deal in terms of competitive ‌advantage compared to peers,” ​says Piyush ‌Goyal

title: NCERT textbook row: Kerala Education Minister welcomes SC intervention, seeks probe
content: In a Facebook post, Minister V. Sivankutty welcomes apex court’s stand against references that allegedly undermined the judiciary

title: Ready for narco test to establish truth in POCSO case: Swami Avimukteshwaranand
content: Avimukteshwaranand said even if any wrongdoing had occurred, it would not automatically establish who was responsible. “The child who never came to us cannot be easily linked to our name,” he said.

title: Last rites of former soldier exposes practice of untouchability in Karnataka village
content: Officials visit village in Bagalkot district of Karnataka following complaints of shops being closed during final rites of Hanumanthappa Harijan

title: SC collegium decides to transfer judges proposed to be CJs of HCs well in advance
content: The collegium, headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant, said the decision was taken so that the judge, becomes well conversant with the affairs of that High Court and assumes charge of the office of the Chief Justice

title: Rohith Vemula Bill, honour killing Bill referred for further review: Karnataka minister
content: Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister H.K. Patil said the proposed legislations were examined in detail, and certain aspects required additional consultation with the home department.

title: Industry must invest, innovate; take advantage of Budget announcements: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister was addressing a post-Budget webinar on ‘Technology, Reforms and Finance for Viksit Bharat’

title: Booking of tickets for ‘The Kerala Story 2’ going on despite stay: Kerala HC
content: Booking of tickets for the movie was possible and therefore, there was a possibilty the film might be screened in theatres during the day, despite the interim stay on its release, the lawyers said

title: Priority to Kannada in administration emphasised at 12th Dharwad Taluk Kannada Sahitya Sammelana
content: Dharwad Taluk 12th Kannada Sahitya Sammelana was held at Alur Venkatrao Bhavan in Dharwad on February 26

title: Sustainable practices adopted in space offer lessons for NE States in renewable energy: Shukla
content: He commended Meghalaya's efforts to promote clean energy in rural and remote regions where conventional electricity supply remains a challenge

title: Woman hacked to death on suspicion of practising witchcraft in Jharkhand, one held
content: The incident took place in Baghima Ambatoli village under the Palkot Police Station limits on Wednesday, 25, when the woman was attacked by two men

title: 30,514 students to appear for second PUC exams in Kalaburagi district
content: As many as 51 examination centres have been set up across the district, including 25 in urban areas and 26 in taluk regions

title: Uproar as Muslim family faces eviction pressure in Muzaffarnagar locality from anti-social elements
content: The opposition Congress hit out at the State government for emboldening anti-social elements who create communal division in U.P.

title: Questioning begins in online abuse of actress Anasuya; technical hurdles slow probe
content: Earlier, Cyberabad Police had booked 73 individuals in connection with the case, which is being investigated by a team of around a dozen officers

title: Vande Mataram to be sung every morning in Rajasthan Panchayati Raj offices: Minister
content: The Panchayati Raj Minister said that only India-made products would be used in all Ministry offices. If foreign-made items are found in use, the cost would be recovered from the concerned official

title: O. Panneerselvam joins DMK; says ‘happy to be part of Thai Kazhagam’
content: “The entire country is closely watching the leadership of CM M.K. Stalin. He has set the grammar for how to run a political party,” Mr. Paneerselvam told the media

title: KSU leader’s house in Kozhikode attacked with country bomb amid political tensions in Kerala
content: Bomb was allegedly hurled at house of KSU Kozhikode district secretary Bithul Balan at Thiruvallur around 2.30 a.m.

title: Former DMK MLA, six others get life imprisonment for farmer’s murder in Tiruvannamalai
content: The police said Kamalakannan was the son of former DMK MLA Jayaraman, who served as the Vandavasi MLA from 2006. After Jayaraman’s sudden death, Kamalakannan contested as a DMK candidate and won in the by-election held in 2009

title: JSS Polytechnic to offer diploma courses for physically challenged persons in Mysuru
content: JSS Polytechnic for the Differently Abled will be offering various diploma courses exclusively for physically challenged students in Mysuru

title: Ramesh Chennithala seeks Kerala CM’s resignation alleging data leak of 1 crore citizens
content: Chennithala seeks criminal proceedings against Chief Minister and all officials who were part of the alleged ‘illegal transaction’

title: Officials on Bengal SIR work enter Odisha village by 'mistake', assaulted by locals, 72 arrested
content: “The incident took place on February 26 when the two officials entered a village in Raibania police station area in Balasore district, which shares a border with West Bengal,” says police

title: 8 cheetahs from Africa to arrive at M.P.'s Kuno National Park on Saturday
content: This will be the third batch of cheetahs arriving from Africa, following earlier introductions from Namibia and South Africa

title: Inter-caste row: Bridegroom stoned to death by bride’s family members, hours after wedding
content: East Godavari Superintendent of Police D. Narasimha Kishore said in a release that the family members of the bride have reportedly stoned the groom to death at around 11:30 p.m. on February 26

title: President Murmu flies sortie in LCH 'Prachand' near India-Pakistan border in Jaisalmer
content: Before the sortie, the captain briefed the President. Dressed in an olive green uniform and helmet, she waved from the cockpit before departing

title: Thotlakonda Buddhist Complex to open new interpretation centre in Visakhapatnam
content: A new interpretation centre at the ancient Thotlakonda Buddhist site will open on March 1, displaying key excavated remains and archival photographs for visitors

title: 'Nagpur Communal Ecosystem for Rewriting of Textbooks' is real NCERT: Congress' dig at govt
content: The government expressed anguish over the inclusion of the controversial section in the book, with Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan promising to fix accountability and take action against those involved in drafting it

title: Watch: From take-off to turbulence: What is going wrong with UDAN scheme?
content: Launched in 2016, the UDAN scheme aimed to make air travel affordable and connect smaller towns across India. We break down what the scheme promised, what the numbers reveal, and the larger questions around its long-term sustainability.

title: In Andhra city, a morning staple turns deadly
content: Five persons died and fifteen others, including three infants, are on ventilator support with acute renal failure after consuming what is believed to be adulterated milk supplied by a vendor to 106 families between February 16 and 18 in Rajamahendravaram city. T. Appalanaidu finds out what exactly happened

title: Under POCSO, consent on trial
content: For over a decade, the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012, has served as India’s dedicated law against child sexual abuse. As families invoke it to oppose under-18 consensual inter-caste and inter-faith relationships, Aaratrika Bhaumik finds that courts are now confronting the law’s unintended consequences

title: Deadlines, disputes, doubts dog UMEED for waqf properties
content: Telangana’s waqf institutions are caught in a high-pressure race to digitise decades and centuries-old records on the UMEED portal, launched by the Centre to bring transparency and efficiency to waqf management

title: Man killed in wild elephant attack at Aralam farm in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Local residents said presence of wild elephants in the area has intensified again after a brief lull, raising fresh concern over safety in the farm region

title: Kerala Health Minister Veena George discharged from Kannur hospital; further treatment in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Meanwhile, a photograph of the Minister taken with nurses at the Government Medical College Hospital has drawn criticism from political opponents. The selfie reportedly clicked inside the ICU has been questioned over protocol and decorum

title: Cricketer Rinku Singh's father passes away after prolonged illness
content: After hearing the death news of his father, Rinku Singh has left the team in the middle of the T20 World Cup tournament

title: Supreme Court collegium recommends Justice Sushrut Arvind Dharmadhikari as next CJ of Madras HC
content: Hailing from Madhya Pradesh, Justice Dharmadhikari was born on July 8, 1966, in Raipur and obtained his Bachelor’s degree in commerce and law from Nagpur University

title: How are predictive policing and traffic management tools used on Indian roads? | Explained
content: Intelligent, tech-based policing is being implemented across major cities in India, bringing both benefits as well as concerns

title: Two key panels urge Karnataka government to align recruitments with changing economy
content: The Karnataka Policy and Planning Commission and the Karnataka Administrative Reforms Commission have against ‘automatic’ replacement of retiring staff

title: Frozen wages, soaring prices
content: The compounded inflation rate in Karnataka between 2012 and 2024 has been calculated to be at 208.3%. With minumum wage revision hanging fire, workers have a tough time coping wit h the rising cost of living, reports Sharath S. Srivatsa

title: PM orders accountability over NCERT judiciary ‘corruption’ content; Education Minister vows action
content: The Education Ministry writes to the Information and Broadcasting (I&B) Ministry and the Electronics and Information Technology Ministry (MeitY) to stop dissemination of the controversial textbook via digital platforms and media

title: CAG’s Bihar report for 2023 flags revenue arrears to government
content: The audit report noted that the Mines and Geology Department has failed to provide details on these dues for more than five years

title: CM Stalin lays foundation for construction of elevated corridor from Thiruvanmiyur to Uthandi
content: The work would be carried out on a hybrid annuity model (HAM) — a mix of engineering, procurement and construction (EPC), and build, operate, transfer (BOT) models

title: Mithali Raj inaugurates Riviera 2026 at VIT in Vellore
content: As part of the pro-shows of Riviera 2026, playback singer Sunidhi Chauhan’s performance was part of the inaugural on Thursday

title: NLCIL signs MoU with NPTI for skill development programme
content: According to a press note, the collaboration between NLCIL and NPTI is to provide a job-oriented Diploma Course

title: Marathon held as part of VIT’s fest ‘Riviera 2026’
content: Faculty members and foreign students also participated in the marathon, which covered busy stretches around Katpadi

title: Chief Justice of India to visit Tirupati on February 28
content: Ahead of the scheduled visit, a team of officials led by District Collector S. Venkateswar, Joint Collector R. Govinda Rao, trainee Collector Sandeep Raghuvanshi, Superintendent of Police L. Subbarayudu Tirupati Airport Director Bhuminathan and others inspected the site being readied for the ‘Bhumi Puja’.

title: Congress alleges irregularities in land acquisition for Adani coal block in M.P.’s Singrauli, seeks joint panel
content: The demand, raised by Leader of Opposition Umang Singhar, led to intense discussions and arguments between the Treasury and Opposition benches which further led to the Congress MLAs staging a walkout from the House.

title: PM Modi interacts with Indian-origin Jews in Israel, lauds their 'deep-rooted' India connection
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) called the community “vibrant” and said, “Their enduring bond with India, traditions carried across generations and remarkable contributions to Israel serve as a living bridge between our countries.”

title: Railway Minister announces portal to attract innovative tech solutions
content: The policy proposes a dedicated innovation portal to enable open submissions of detailed proposals, and provides financial support of up to 50% of the development cost for selected solutions

title: From the ashes, emerges a green idea at Brahmapuram
content: The first Compressed Biogas plant in the State, which converts biodegradable waste into biogas, has become operational at the Brahmapuram garbage treatment yard of the Kochi Corporation. M.P. Praveen meets the engineers and managers of the plant set up by the BPCL Kochi Refinery at the plant site to learn about the facility, which is expected to solve the issue of waste management in the city

title: Stand-off between Delhi and H.P. police forces triggers political row in hill State
content: Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu termed Delhi Police’s action ‘an attempt to undermine the sovereignty of the State’

title: Supreme Court adjourns plea challenging Sonam Wangchuk’s detention under NSA to March 10
content: A Bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and P.B. Varale said it would go through the videos of Wangchuk’s speeches submitted to the court

title: Garbage trucks continue to emit foul smell in Chennai; residents call for solutions
content: During the 2024 Budget presentation of GCC, Mayor R. Priya had announced that fish nets would be procured for 102 tipper vehicles to prevent spillage.

title: NITI Aayog panel on critical minerals wants joint efforts, policy support for self-reliance
content: Singareni reiterates resolve to actively contribute to the mission through strategic partnerships, innovation

title: ₹397 crore transformer procurement scam: Madras High Court calls for DVAC inquiry report and minutes of tender committee meetings
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan pass the orders on a 2024 writ petition filed by Arappor Iyakkam for registration of a FIR

title: DMK trying to confuse the minorities about alliance, says Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: AIADMK stands for all religions; ‘think about the welfare programmes implemented by AIADMK for your benefit,’  the AIADMK general secretary says in an appeal to the minorities

title: Family courts can’t be liberal in giving adjournments only because litigant is a woman: Karnataka High Court
content: The High Court imposed cost on a woman for intentionally dragging the matter and wasting time of courts

title: Activists flag concern over Karnataka’s proposed Right to Health Bill
content: Questions raised over whether the Bill meaningfully advances the right to health or dilutes the State’s responsibility as the primary provider of care

title: ECI reviews  preparedness for the coming Assembly election in Tamil Nadu
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, along with Election Commissioners Sukhbir Singh Sandhu and Vivek Joshi, interacted with representatives of the recognised national and State political parties and sought their suggestions

title: Develop protocol for filling vacancies in open correctional institutions, Supreme Court tells States
content: Bench says prisons are institutions of correction, where dignity, self-respect and social reintegration are not aspirational ideals but constitutional necessities

title: Sunetra Pawar unanimously elected as NCP national president
content: Praful Patel re-elected as national working president, Sunil Tatkare as State chief; Ajit Pawar’s son Parth to become Rajya Sabha MP

title: Watch | Maharashtra–Karnataka border row back in focus: Why is it still unresolved?
content: The decades-old Maharashtra–Karnataka border dispute was once again raised in the Maharashtra Assembly, with Governor Acharya Devvrat reiterating the government’s commitment to resolve the issue.

title: 'No overarching conspiracy or criminal intent': Why court cleared Kejriwal, Sisodia in excise case
content: A Delhi court discharged Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia, and 21 others in the excise policy case, citing a lack of cogent evidence and no prima facie case. The judge found no overarching conspiracy or criminal intent in the policy's formulation, criticising the CBI's investigative approach and reliance on approver statements.

title: Strong earthquake tremors felt in Kolkata
content: Kolkata residents experienced strong tremors on Friday afternoon as a 4.9 magnitude earthquake struck near the India-Bangladesh border, with its epicenter just 3 km inside Bangladesh. This follows a similar unsettling experience on February 3rd when a 6.1 magnitude earthquake, originating in Myanmar, also caused panic across the region. Authorities are confirming details of the latest seismic event.

title: ‘Cup of patience has overflowed’: Why Pakistan launched strikes on Afghanistan's major cities
content: Pakistan conducted air strikes on major Afghan cities, including Kabul, Kandahar, and Paktia, escalating border tensions. This action follows retaliatory attacks by Taliban forces, with Pakistan declaring an "open war" after cross-border clashes. The confrontation marks a significant escalation since the Taliban's return to power in 2021.

title: ‘No words feel enough’: Ex-cricketers stand with Rinku after father’s passing
content: Former cricketers are extending heartfelt condolences to Rinku Singh following the passing of his father, Khanchand Singh. Rinku, who left the T20 World Cup to be with his family, is receiving support from figures like Harbhajan Singh, Yuvraj Singh, and Virender Sehwag. IPL franchises have also shared their sympathies during this difficult period.

title: Watch: Teary Kejriwal's emotional moment with wife Sunita & kids
content: A Delhi court discharged Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia in the liquor excise policy case, refusing to take cognisance of the CBI chargesheet. The court found no criminal intent or substantiated conspiratorial role, stating allegations failed judicial scrutiny. Both leaders were greeted with emotional celebrations by family and supporters.

title: Block lays off 40% staff after CEO Jack Dorsey calls layoffs 'destructive to morale'
content: Block, led by CEO Jack Dorsey, has drastically cut its workforce by nearly half, impacting over 4,000 employees. Dorsey cited a shift towards leaner, AI-driven operations as the reason, preferring a single, decisive layoff to avoid prolonged uncertainty and morale damage. Generous severance packages are being offered to departing staff.

title: 5 months, 17 months, and finally freedom: Kejriwal, Sisodia cleared in Delhi excise case
content: Former Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia were acquitted in the Delhi excise policy case. Kejriwal spent five months in jail, while Sisodia was incarcerated for 17 months. The case, investigated by the CBI and ED, alleged irregularities in the 2021-22 liquor policy.

title: ‘I was surprised’: Gavaskar hails ‘defensive’ Abhishek as opener silences critics
content: Batting legend Sunil Gavaskar expressed surprise at Abhishek Sharma's defensive shot during India's T20 World Cup win over Zimbabwe on Thursday. Sharma's fluent 55, ending a streak of ducks, showcased a new maturity. Gavaskar believes this experience marks significant growth for the young batter, preparing him for crucial upcoming matches.

title: Fresh look at India-US trade deal? May be ‘rebalanced’ if circumstances change, says Goyal
content: Piyush Goyal’s comments assume significance after the US Supreme Court ruled that Donald Trump administration's reciprocal tariffs are illegal. Soon after, Trump signed an executive order to impose a 10% global tariff on America’s trading partners.

title: Not just Cursor: Other US tech startups ask staff to leave shoes behind
content: A viral social media post highlights a growing trend in San Francisco's tech scene: a 'no shoes' policy at offices. Startups like Cursor, Replo, and Spur are encouraging employees to shed their footwear, aiming to create a more relaxed, home-like atmosphere.

title: Haryana govt official jumps to death from 6th floor of civil secretariat in Chandigarh
content: A special secretary at the Haryana civil secretariat, Ganesh Das Arora, 58, died by suicide by jumping from his office building. A suicide note found at the scene stated no external pressure, though workplace stress is being investigated. Arora was reportedly distressed over a recent department transfer and was due to retire in October.

title: T20 WC Super 8s standings: India set for virtual QF as SA seal semis spot
content: Defending champions India face a crucial Super 8 clash against the West Indies on Sunday. A victory in Kolkata will secure their semi-final spot in the T20 World Cup. South Africa has already qualified from Group 1. Meanwhile, England have advanced from Group 2, with New Zealand and Pakistan vying for the remaining berth.

title: Watch: President Murmu take sortie in indigenous light combat helicopter 'Prachand'
content: President Droupadi Murmu experienced a flight in the indigenously built Light Combat Helicopter 'Prachand' near the Pakistan border in Jaisalmer. This advanced aircraft, designed for diverse terrains and equipped with modern weaponry, significantly enhances the Indian Air Force's capabilities. The President's sortie underscores India's growing self-reliance in defense technology.

title: 'I am kattar imaandaar': Kejriwal breaks down after clean chit in liquor policy case
content: Former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia have been acquitted of all charges. The Rouse Avenue court delivered the verdict in the case investigated by the CBI. Both leaders had faced allegations and served time in jail. Kejriwal stated that truth always wins. This development marks a significant moment for the Aam Aadmi Party.

title: Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia acquitted in Delhi excise policy case
content: A Delhi court has acquitted former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia in the excise policy case. The CBI had alleged a Rs 100 crore bribe from a "south lobby" to influence the policy. The court's decision marks a significant development in the high-profile political case.

title: Did Pakistan lose another F-16? Afghanistan makes big claim; shares video
content: Afghanistan claims Pakistan's F-16 jet was downed during overnight strikes targeting multiple Afghan cities. Pakistan retaliated for alleged 'unprovoked firing' with Operation Ghazab Lil Haq, reportedly destroying Afghan military bases. This incident echoes past claims of Pakistan's F-16s being targeted during regional tensions, including India's Operation Sindoor.

title: Indore-Pune Air India Express flight’s rough landing causes scare for 160 flyers
content: An Air India Express flight from Indore to Pune experienced a jarring touchdown, prompting the pilot to abort and circle back for a safe landing approximately 25 minutes later. Passengers reported a rough and unsettling experience, with the cabin crew offering no immediate explanation. The airline's spokesperson was contacted for details regarding the incident.

title: Gutkha stains, litter spotted at newly-launched Namo Bharat RRTS stations
content: The newly launched Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat RRTS corridor saw massive footfall on its first full day, exceeding one lakh riders. However, scenes of littering and gutkha stains at stations have raised concerns about commuter responsibility. This highlights the need for stricter enforcement of cleanliness norms to preserve the world-class infrastructure.

title: Rinku Singh’s father passes away after battle with cancer
content: Indian cricketer Rinku Singh's father, Khanchand Singh, has passed away after a battle with advanced liver cancer. He was on ventilator support at a Greater Noida hospital. Rinku, part of the T20 World Cup squad, had briefly returned home earlier due to his father's deteriorating health. His father was a pillar of support for his cricketing dreams.

title: Umar Akmal clears air over post on Babar Azam: 'Not comparing myself with him'
content: Umar Akmal clarified his recent social media post, stating he did not intend to compare himself to Babar Azam or disrespect the Pakistan captain. Akmal explained his intention was to highlight that Azam's batting style is not ideally suited for the T20 middle order, emphasizing role suitability rather than a direct comparison of achievements.

title: Pizzagate and leaked photos: Hillary Clinton faces tough questions over Epstein files
content: Hillary Clinton testified for over six hours before the House Oversight Committee regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, denying any knowledge of their criminal activities. She stated she never encountered Epstein or flew on his plane, and suggested the committee question Donald Trump about his extensive ties to Epstein.

title: 'I lack eyesight, but not vision': Srikanth Bolla’s rise from rejection to success
content: Born visually impaired in rural India, Srikanth Bolla defied societal expectations and institutional barriers to pursue science education. Rejected by Indian institutions, he gained admission to MIT, becoming the first international blind student. Returning to India, he founded Bollant Industries, an eco-friendly packaging company that prioritizes employing people with disabilities, transforming opportunity into dignity.

title: Expelled AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam joins DMK in presence of TN CM Stalin
content: Veteran leader O Panneerselvam, a former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister, has officially joined the DMK. This significant political shift follows his expulsion from the AIADMK and comes after failed attempts to unify the party. Sources suggest the DMK may offer him a seat in the upcoming assembly elections, potentially in his former constituency.

title: 'Open war' declared: Pakistan strikes Kabul, Kandahar — 10 things to know about Operation Ghazab Lil Haq
content: Pakistan conducted airstrikes in Afghanistan targeting Taliban military sites. This action followed alleged unprovoked firing from across the border. The operation, named 'Ghazab Lil Haq', reportedly killed 133 Afghans. Afghanistan condemned the strikes, claiming no casualties. Tensions remain high between the two nations over border disputes and recent military actions.

title: Pune real estate agent plans suicide, smothers wife instead; arrested
content: A 56-year-old Pune real estate agent has been arrested for allegedly smothering his 53-year-old wife. The accused reportedly confessed to the crime, stating financial woes and his wife's depression over childlessness as motives. He also admitted to contemplating suicide before killing his wife and later reporting the incident himself.

title: ‘We want to show fear to the opposition’: Tilak Varma’s bold message after India’s win
content: Tilak Varma's explosive unbeaten 44 off 16 balls, and aggressive contributions from top-order batters powered India to a commanding 72-run victory over Zimbabwe, keeping their semifinal hopes alive.  Adopting a fearless approach, Varma stated the team's intention to instill fear in opponents, emphasizing their commitment to aggressive batting regardless of early wickets.

title: Table No 8 and a 'first date': Israel PM Netanyahu recalls India link behind love story with wife Sara
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu revealed a personal connection to India during a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He shared that one of his first dates with his wife, Sara, took place at an Indian restaurant in Tel Aviv, owned by Reena Pushkarna. “I owe India a great personal debt. When I met Sara (his wife) for the first time, I think our first or second date was in an Indian restaurant in Tel Aviv. It was Reena Pushkarna,” he said.

title: 'Shotgun wedding': Teenage lovers skip exam to marry at temple
content: A teenage couple in Varanasi, aiming to marry instead of taking their UP Board exams, were intercepted by police. Officers responsibly escorted the students to their respective exam centers first. Post-examination, the 17-year-old girl was taken to the child welfare committee, and both were later permitted to return home after age verification.

title: NFL Combine 2026: Who is Sonny Styles? Linebacker turns heads
content: Sonny Styles' NFL combine performance dominated the NFL Scouting Combine, showcasing elite speed with a 4.46 40-yard dash and a remarkable 43.5-inch vertical jump. His impressive measurables at 6-foot-5 and 244 pounds have propelled him into legitimate early first-round draft discussions, validating his versatile college performance. After this NFL combine performance, Sonny Styles is no longer just a productive college linebacker. He is a legitimate early first-round discussion, powered by blazing speed and a vertical jump that turned heads across the league.

title: Indo-Israeli fire control systems clear field trials, fitted on 96 Army T-72 tanks
content: The Indian Army has successfully installed Indo-Israeli Thermal Imaging Fire Control Systems on 96 T-72 tanks, enhancing their night and low-visibility combat capabilities. Developed and manufactured in Bengaluru by Alpha-Elsec Defence & Aerospace Systems, these systems cleared firing validation trials before induction, bolstering the Army's armoured fleet.

title: Ajith Kumar's Chennai home: Actor blends luxury with minimalism
content: Actor Ajith Kumar's serene Chennai home, valued at Rs 12-15 crore, offers a minimalist yet stylish retreat. The Thiruvanmiyur property boasts a blend of traditional and contemporary design, featuring lush greenery, a beach view, and resort-like amenities. This tranquil abode contrasts with his dynamic professional life, which includes a return to racing and an upcoming film.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,450; Sensex down over 250 points
content: Analysts are of the view that the stock market is likely to move within a narrow range amid mixed global signals, with stock-specific trends expected to dominate trading.

title: 'Assaulted repeatedly': Class 10 student who delivered baby in exam hall tells MP cops
content: A Class 10 student in Dhar district delivered a baby during her board exam, revealing she was repeatedly sexually assaulted by a known youth. The accused allegedly forced physical relations after she refused his proposal and continued to do so, leading to a concealed pregnancy due to fear and stigma.

title: Uttarakhand horror: 15-year-old forced to drink, gang-raped in car; 2 held
content: Two taxi drivers lured a 15-year-old student away on the pretext of visiting a tourist spot in Haldwani. They allegedly forced her to consume alcohol and raped her in their car at a secluded location. The accused, aged 20 and 24, were arrested after the survivor's family filed a complaint.

title: Will IIT cross-campus mobility deliver real academic choice?
content: For years, an IIT seat meant four years within one campus. Now, students may take courses and in some cases spend a semester at another IIT, with credits counted back home. The reform promises wider exposure and flexibility, but limited seats, selection rules, logistics and internal hierarchy questions will determine whether this becomes meaningful change or a carefully controlled pilot.

title: 'Papa gaali dete the': Arshdeep reveals how India kept tabs on SA vs WI in Ahmedabad
content: India’s Super Eight fate briefly hinged on the West Indies vs South Africa clash. After South Africa’s win kept their hopes alive, India responded with a clinical performance against Zimbabwe. Backing their “brand of cricket” and team-first approach, the Men in Blue now head into a virtual quarter-final against the West Indies with renewed belief.

title: New GDP data series from today: What are the top changes in the methodology? FAQs answered
content: The new series of data not only revises the base year for calculation purposes to 2022-23, it also incorporates several vital changes with an aim to give a more accurate measurement of the size of the Indian economy and its real and nominal GDP growth.

title: FIFA World Cup 2026 crisis: Canada seen as safest gateway
content: Travel restrictions in the United States and rising security concerns in Mexico are complicating plans for the FIFA World Cup 2026. With visa bans affecting many nations and violence raising safety worries near host cities, Canada is emerging as the most accessible and stable destination. Its streamlined visa system and secure environment could shift fan travel and boost attendance there.

title: ‘Pelted banners and sticks, threw shoes’: Students detained for breaking JNU gate lock
content: A JNUSU protest against alleged casteist remarks by Vice-Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit escalated into a two-hour clash with police after students broke open the locked main gate to march towards the education ministry. Police, who said no permission was granted, detained several students and reported injuries on both sides, as tensions continued on campus into the evening.

title: 'Will pee in your mouth': UP GRP sub-inspector assaults vendor over delay in serving tea, suspended
content: A Government Railway Police sub-inspector in Agra has been suspended after CCTV footage showed him assaulting a tea vendor at Mathura Junction. The officer allegedly slapped the vendor and used abusive language over a delay in serving tea. An inquiry has been initiated following the incident.

title: Strong Earthquake Tremors Felt In Kolkata, Offices Evacuated
content: Kolkata Earthquake Today: The magnitude of the earthquake or the epicentre was immediately not clear.

title: 'Don't Doubt Judicial Officers': Supreme Court In Bengal vs Poll Body
content: The Election Commission has given a training module to judicial officers in West Bengal to help out with the special intensive revision (SIR) process in the state, the Mamata Banerjee government told the Supreme Court.

title: Who Is Justice Dharmadhikari, Madras High Court Chief Justice Pick
content: Justice Dharmadhikari's career has been shaped by a mix of courtroom work, administrative responsibility, and major public interest litigation.

title: Solar Infra Blamed For Madhya Pradesh Tigress' Death. Why It's Alarming
content: Eight tiger deaths were reported in Madhya Pradesh, three by electrocution, including the latest of a tigress allegedly by continuous electric current from solar-powered fencing.

title: BJP's AI-Driven Strategy, "Assembly Charge Sheets" For 2026 State Polls
content: The BJP's strategy comes ahead of assembly elections in five states: West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Assam, and Puducherry.

title: 17 Disabled Children Die At Ujjain Ashram In 14 Months, High Court Takes Note
content: The court issued notices to top administrative officials, demanding answers within two weeks, over the deaths of 17 disabled children at the Ankit Sewadham Ashram in Ujjain.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Nearly 10,000 Layoffs In 2025: Why Are Indian Startups On A Firing Spree?
content: In an age where trendy co-working office spaces have replaced humble garages as startup symbols, the current slump is best seen as a mirror to show some deeper realities.

title: Droupadi Murmu Becomes 1st Indian President To Fly In Attack Helicopter Prachand
content: Clad in an olive-green flying suit and helmet, President Droupadi Murmu on Friday took a 25-minute sortie as co-pilot in Light Combat Helicopter 'Prachand' near the India-Pakistan border in Jaisalmer district.

title: Forced To Quit Over Epstein Ties, How Joichi Ito Rebuilt His Career In Japan
content: He once held top positions at some of America's most prestigious institutions. Forced to resign over his close ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Joichi Ito has now quietly rebuilt his professional life in Japan.

title: Soviet Union, US Coalition, And Now Pakistan: Afghan Military's New Test
content: The Pakistani Air Force (PAF) just bombed several cities in a neighbouring country which was once described by much stronger forces as a place where there were only rocks and mountains.

title: Arvind Kejriwal Breaks Down After Court Relief, Manish Sisodia Consoles Him
content: Arvind Kejriwal recounted that he was picked up from his home and thrown into jail. That did not break him. Nearly two years later, he broke down in tears when a court cleared him of all charges in the Delhi liquor policy case.

title: "Political Case With No Basis": Bhagwant Mann On Arvind Kejriwal Clean Chit
content: After a Delhi court cleared former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia in the alleged liquor policy corruption case, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann strongly welcomed the decision

title: Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia Cleared In Liquor Policy Case, Court Raps CBI
content: Delhi Liquor Policy Case: A Delhi court has cleared former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia in a case of alleged corruption in making a new policy to sell liquor in the national capital.

title: 2 Medical College Students Arrested For Snatching Gold Chain In Uttarakhand
content: Two students of the Sushila Tiwari Medical College in Haldwani were arrested for allegedly snatching a gold chain and a mobile phone from a woman in the Jauljibi area here, police said on Thursday.

title: Indian-Origin Man Jailed For 12 Years For Raping Domestic Worker In Singapore
content: An Indian-origin Malaysian man was sentenced in Singapore to 12 years' jail and 12 strokes of the cane for raping a domestic worker outside a train station after tricking her into thinking that he was a police officer.

title: Indian Students, Skilled Workers Lead UK Visa Extensions Tally
content: Indian students and skilled workers, including in the healthcare sector, continue to top the tally of visa extensions granted by the UK, according to official migration statistics released by the Home Office in London on Thursday.

title: Video: Hugs And Smiles, Arvind Kejriwal Celebrates Court Relief With Family
content: In an emotional reception, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal met his wife Sunita Kejriwal and his children at his New Delhi residence after a court refused to frame charges against him in the liquor policy scam case.

title: Mamdani Presents Trump With Mock Newspaper To Seek $21 Billion Housing Aid
content: Zohran Mamdani presented Donald Trump with a mock New York Daily News front page as he sought federal backing for a $21 billion housing plan.

title: Live Updates: "Arvind Kejriwal Was Sent To Jail For Sake Of Power," Says Wife Sunita Kejriwal
content: Delhi Excise Policy Case LIVE Updates: During the judgment, the court said it found no evidence against Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia, and that the CBI's allegations "lacked substance".

title: Matt Holliday's Stillwater estate listed for $12 million
content: a Stillwater, Oklahoma, home that once belonged to an MLB champion and seven-time All-Star is on the market at $12 million . the home features sports-related amenities such as a professionally lit baseball field in the front yard, a putting green in the backyard, and a $2 million, two-level swimming pool . indoor batting cages, pickleball and basketball courts reside in a detached $150,000 guest home on the property .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .
